intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. major, commonly known as cauliflower, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, curd-like inflorescence composed of tightly packed flower buds that do not open. The plant typically grows to a height of 40–100 cm and has thick, fleshy stems and large, dark green, lobed leaves. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Cauliflower is a widely cultivated vegetable valued for its mild flavor and nutritional content.
